name: Follows-Chalk
location: Across the bridge North of theSouthern passage

topics.topic_text: FollowersAcknowledgeMyOrder
topics.response_text: Got it.

topics.topic: FollowersFiredIt's time for us to part ways.
topics.topic_text: Go back to your people's camp.
topics.response_text: You sure? It's easy to get lost out here without a guide.

topics.topic_text: On second thought, stick with me for a little longer.
topics.response_text: Glad to hear it. I wouldn't want to go back to Joshua alone.

topics.topic_text: Yes, I'm sure.
topics.response_text: All right. Joshua won't be too happy, but all right.

topics.topic: FollowersHiredI think we should travel together.
topics.topic_text: I want you to travel with me.
topics.response_text: Joshua said I might be going with you. Let's go then!

topics.topic_text: Let's get going.
topics.response_text: Right behind you.

topics.topic_text: FollowersOverburdened
topics.response_text: I look like a pack Brahmin to you? Come on, we travel light!

topics.topic_text: FollowersStealthing
topics.response_text: Like the shadow of a ghost.

topics.topic_text: Let's talk about your tactics.
topics.response_text: Tactics? You know I'm not much of a fighter, right?

topics.topic_text: I want you to change your combat style.
topics.response_text: Change it to...?

topics.topic_text: I want you to attack enemies the moment you see them.
topics.response_text: You're starting to sound like the old Joshua. Okay, got it.

topics.topic_text: That's it for your tactics. Let's talk about something else.
topics.response_text: What can I do?

topics.topic_text: That's all. Let's get going.
topics.response_text: Lead on, I'll follow.

topics.topic_text: Switch to a melee weapon.
topics.response_text: Up close and personal? Well, as long as they don't have guns.

topics.topic_text: I want you not to attack enemies unless I've already engaged them.
topics.response_text: Now you're thinking like a hunter! I like this plan.

topics.topic_text: I want you to use ranged weapons.
topics.response_text: Keeping my distance sounds more my speed anyways.

topics.topic_text: Let's talk about how close you're following me.
topics.response_text: Just tell me where to be, and I'll be there.

topics.topic_text: Stay close to me.
topics.response_text: Fine by me - get too far back and it's easy to lose your partner in this maze.

topics.topic_text: Your distance is good. Let's talk about something else.
topics.response_text: What can I do?

topics.topic_text: All right, you're good. Let's get out of here.
topics.response_text: Lead on, I'll follow.

topics.topic_text: Keep your distance. Try to flank them.
topics.response_text: Sure... you are going to leave me some chalk marks to follow though, right?

topics.topic_text: Enough about tactics.
topics.response_text: What can I do?

topics.topic_text: Let's trade equipment.
topics.response_text: Well then, let's get to trading.

topics.topic_text: Wait here.
topics.response_text: Sure, okay. I'll wait behind. Not like I'm not used to that.

topics.topic_text: GREETING
topics.response_text: Hoi! White Legs don't leave survivors often. You're some kind of lucky, let me tell you.

topics.topic_text: Nothing else. Talk to you later.
topics.response_text: Go with fortune, friend.

topics.topic_text: I want to know more about you.
topics.response_text: What can I tell you?

topics.topic_text: I don't have any more questions. Let's talk about something else.
topics.response_text: Ask away.

topics.topic_text: Why are you called Follows-Chalk?
topics.response_text: Our advance scouts leave chalk signs to mark places rich with game. I'm not a full scout yet, so I follow the marks and guide the hunters.

topics.topic_text: Tell me more about Joshua Graham.
topics.response_text: He's been the chief of our tribe since he came back to the Valley. He went off to the civilized world years ago, to fight a war. That didn't go well.

topics.topic_text: Who were those tribals who attacked me?
topics.response_text: White Legs - nasty bunch. They been raiding deeper into Zion ever since New Canaan was wiped out.

topics.topic_text: I'll do what I can, but I need to defend myself if I'm attacked.
topics.response_text: Of course you do - I understand. You know, I heard stories about rangers from Back When - they carried lightning sticks that stunned the animals.

topics.topic_text: Who is this Joshua?
topics.response_text: Joshua Graham - he leads our tribe. Thanks to him, the Dead Horses are strong, and safe from our enemies.

topics.topic_text: Civilized lands? What do you mean?
topics.response_text: I mean the Lands Beyond the Valley - the place where the cities never fell. Where people don't live in tribes and forage just to survive.

topics.topic_text: I don't have time for this. Go away.
topics.response_text: {Fine}Lah, I meant no offense - if you won't talk to me, talk to Joshua Graham - he's at our camp on the Eastern Virgin.

topics.topic_text: What are all those tattoos?
topics.response_text: Dead Horses mark ourselves to commemorate our hunts. When a hunter takes a great beast, or when a youth goes on his first hunt, he gets a tattoo.

topics.topic_text: Tell me about your tribe.
topics.response_text: We came up in the Land of the Dead Horse, though why the Back When folks called it that I got no hint.

topics.topic_text: What did Joshua do for you?
topics.response_text: If it wasn't for Joshua, the Dead Horses would still be the whipping boys of the Zion Valley.

topics.topic_text: Do you remember anything about Joshua from before he became your leader?
topics.response_text: Only a little - I was very young. He was... different. Prouder, yes, but harder, crueler, more driven. Really, I was terrified of him. We all were.

topics.topic_text: Tell me a little about this area - any interesting wildlife?
topics.response_text: Mostly it's the mountain Bighorners - whole herd of them up on the cliffs there. Usually they're not too aggressive, but lately... hoo!

topics.topic_text: What do you know about the New Canaanites?
topics.response_text: Little bit. I met some of their missionaries a few times, but I've never been to their city. Joshua could tell you more - or Daniel, I imagine.

topics.topic_text: What's with the shell casings in your club?
topics.response_text: We decorate our clubs with them to honor Joshua Graham. They were the weapons of his old tribe, so now they are ours.

topics.topic_text: Maybe I can help with that.
topics.response_text: Yeah? Hey, thanks - most of the hunters don't listen when I tell them the problem.

topics.topic_text: All right, I'll look into it.
topics.response_text: That's great! I'll help any way I can.

topics.topic_text: That sounds like way too much work. Maybe later.
topics.response_text: Oh sure, that's just what the hunters said. Well... I guess let me know if you change your mind.

topics.topic_text: Well, I returned the calf to its mother, and didn't even kill any of the Bighorners.
topics.response_text: Hoo! Glad to hear it! That'll be some happy mama, huh? Thank you - really. It means a lot to me.

topics.topic_text: Well, I returned the calf to its herd. Had to kill a few Bighorners to do it, though.
topics.response_text: Sure, hey, I understand. I wish it could have been done different, but at least the calf is back with its herd.

topics.topic_text: Well, all of the Bighorners are dead. Problem solved!
topics.response_text: That's... not really what I was hoping for. I guess... I guess at least we don't have to worry about the Bighorners attacking the camp now. Hoy....

topics.topic_text: Why is it so important that we fight the White Legs?
topics.response_text: {Bewildered - doesn't really understand how this is a question, like "Why is it important to breathe?"}Well... because they're our enemies. What else would we do? They take our land, they kill our scouts, they poach our hunting grounds.

topics.topic_text: Wait, what about Caesar?
topics.response_text: When Joshua first came to us, he was servant to a man he called Caesar. He led his master's armies, and we were ready to follow him into war.

topics.topic_text: All right, let's go.
topics.response_text: {Glad to hear it}Goot sists. We head east, then. Joshua is at our tribe's camp in the Eastern Virgin.

topics.topic_text: What happened to him?
topics.response_text: Well, before he left, he didn't have those bandages all over his face. That tell you something?

topics.topic_text: The only recent war I know of is when Caesar's Legion attacked Hoover Dam. Is that where he fought?
topics.response_text: I don't know, he doesn't talk about it much. Maybe - but how can two civilized tribes fight over something as small as a dam?

topics.topic_text: Small? Have you ever seen Hoover Dam? It's bigger than some of these mountains.
topics.response_text: Hah!{Suddenly realizing the player isn't lying}...Really? That's... my gods. Must be some mighty civilized folks who built that.

topics.topic_text: You'd be surprised what "civilized" tribes will fight over.
topics.response_text: Now you sound like Joshua. He always tells me the tribal life is better, that I should stay here and forget the outside world.

topics.topic_text: Are you sure? You've been a useful companion so far.
topics.response_text: Sorry - Joshua was pretty clear. Get you to Daniel, then come on home. You can take it up with him if you'd like.

topics.topic_text: Give my regards to Joshua, then.
topics.response_text: I will.{Goodbye my friend}Goot gonen, ahk iss.

topics.topic_text: Typical. Just when I get a useful minion....
topics.response_text: Hey, it's not my fault! And what's this "minion" stuff?{That's it}Dahs eet - see you around, "civilized" man.

topics.topic_text: What is this place?
topics.response_text: This is the eastern fork of the Virgin River, and it's the place we Dead Horses call home. Joshua says it is a temple to God's glory on earth.

topics.topic_text: Who are you?
topics.response_text: I'm called Follows-Chalk. Joshua sent me to scout for any outsiders coming up from the Southern Passage.

topics.topic_text: Hang on, I want to know more about what's going on.
topics.response_text: Joshua will answer all your questions. He doesn't like being kept waiting, though - go talk to him as soon as you can.

topics.topic_text: Okay, I'll go talk to him.
topics.response_text: I won't keep you. Maybe we talk again after.

topics.topic_text: I had no reason to stay for that fight.
topics.response_text: But...{confused, stating something that seems blindingly obvious}they were White Legs! The enemy! You are a very strange outsider, but I think Joshua will want to speak to you anyways.

topics.topic_text: White Legs? Who are they?
topics.response_text: Nasty bunch of raiders from up by Great Salt Lake. White Legs killed your friends at the Southern Passage.

topics.topic_text: Huh, I think I know that guy. Small world.
topics.response_text: Is it? I always heard it was rather large outside the valley. Well, wherever he is, I hope he's well.

topics.topic_text: Who is this Joshua?
topics.response_text: Joshua Graham - he leads our tribe. Thanks to him, the Dead Horses are strong, and safe from our enemies.

topics.topic_text: I could use a guide. Let's go.
topics.response_text: {Good}Goot! I really wasn't looking forward to talking to Joshua if you turned me down.

topics.topic_text: No way, pal. I'm not traipsing around the desert with a barbarian who doesn't wear pants.
topics.response_text: I don't think he'll like that answer much. You change your mind, I'll be around the Dead Horses camp.{Goodbye}Goot gonen.

topics.topic_text: What would you suggest I do instead?
topics.response_text: Hmm... you might try luring the baby out with some banana yucca. These Bighorners go crazy for the stuff.

topics.topic_text: You've got a funny idea about what the Mojave's like, but I'll go with you and see your boss.
topics.response_text: {Glad to hear it}Goot sists. Maybe while you're there you can tell me about where you came from, yeah?

topics.topic_text: Wait, what? New Canaan was wiped out? How?
topics.response_text: That's what Joshua said. White Legs came down from Great Salt Lake in force - fell on New Canaan before they could mount a defense.

topics.topic_text: Where do they come from?
topics.response_text: That's the weird part - normally the White Legs keep to the Great Salt Lake. I don't know what brought them down this far south.

topics.topic_text: What does Joshua think of this?
topics.response_text: I, umm, I haven't told him yet. Never had the{guts}growans.

topics.topic_text: Really? Maybe I could talk to him about it for you. Be a neutral party.
topics.response_text: You'd do that? Sure, sounds smart to me. He might not get so mad at you.

topics.topic_text: What's with this obsession you seem to have with "civilization?"
topics.response_text: Let me tell you a story. When I was a boy, a man came through the valley with one of the caravans. Tall man, big mustache, carried a guitar.

topics.topic_text: I had to kill the Bighorners, but I saved the little one.
topics.response_text: That's... not really what I was hoping for, but... I guess I can give the little guy a home. What the hell.

topics.topic_text: He said he has a hard time being objective about the whole idea, and that I should give you advice.
topics.response_text: He said that? Well, I guess you have been out there more recently than he has. So... what's your advice?

topics.topic_text: <Lie> That it's a den of corruption and vice, and the Dead Horses' way of living is better.
topics.response_text: Oh. Well, I guess that's about what I could expect from him. I'd like a minute alone to think about this.{Thanks}Dank ni.

topics.topic_text: <Lie> That a man must follow his heart no matter where it leads him.
topics.response_text: Really? He said that? Hoo! I'm going to do it. After all this is over, I'm going to go explore civilization!

topics.topic_text: I know that guy! I got him a job!
topics.response_text: A job as a singer?{Full of wonder; just got told Santa Claus is real}Then it really is true....

topics.topic_text: Any idea where to start looking for these pre-War supplies Daniel needs?
topics.response_text: Best place to look for Back When stuff is the taboo places. Sorrows and Dead Horses don't go in there, and even White Legs don't like them much.

topics.topic_text: What taboo places?
topics.response_text: Lots of them around the valley - places built by the folk from Back When. You'll know them when you see them - scouts mark them with hand prints.

topics.topic_text: Where should we start looking?
topics.response_text: Lots of Back When places to choose from, but for the things we need, best to start with the really closed up places.

topics.topic_text: You should stay here with your people. You have a duty to them.
topics.response_text: I see. Well, thanks for your telling. I'd like a minute alone to think about this.{Thanks}Dank ni.

topics.topic_text: Civilization isn't perfect, but neither is tribal life. You should go see it for yourself.
topics.response_text: Really? You think so? Hoo! I'm going to do it. After all this is over, I'm going to go explore civilization!

topics.topic_text: What's this "place where the little ones fell?"
topics.response_text: In the river, there's a twisted pile of metal and glass, all full of bones. Joshua says they were scouts, but they looked awful small to me.

topics.topic_text: White Legs? Those are the people who attacked us?
topics.response_text: Yah, and they're still back there! Let's go get them!

topics.topic_text: If you're willing, I'll take the help.
topics.response_text: {Glad to hear it}Goot sists. Let's show them what we're made of!

topics.topic_text: Forget it, I'm out of here.
topics.response_text: You're not going to fight? But... okay. You better come with me, then. Joshua will want to see you.

topics.topic_text: NVDLC02EndingDeadHorses
topics.response_text: {Narration - Joshua Dead}Having revered Joshua Graham as a living legend for so many years, the Dead Horses found it difficult to accept his death.

topics.topic_text: NVDLC02EndingFollowsChalk
topics.response_text: {Narration - Civilization's bad}Follows-Chalk took the Courier's words to heart and decided that the big cities of the Mojave Wasteland and NCR were best left unexplored.

topics.topic_text: That's all. Let's get going.
topics.response_text: Lead on, I'll follow.

topics.topic_text: < Follows-Chalk Aerie Bark >
topics.response_text: See that tower? Back When, folks used them to talk to each other on the air. Not like with signal drums, they could actually talk! Amazing, huh?

topics.topic_text: < Follows-Chalk Ant Burrow Bark >
topics.response_text: Look sharp, lots of giant ants around here. We call 'em picnic-killers. Don't really know what that means. Something from Back When, I guess.

topics.topic_text: < Follows-Chalk Bus Bark >
topics.response_text: See this? This is why your own two feet are better than any cart, whether it's pulled by critters or goes on its own.

topics.topic_text: < Follows-Chalk Campground Bark >
topics.response_text: Must have been nice, when Zion was friendly enough folks could make camp wherever they pleased and not worry about White Legs and deadly critters.

topics.topic_text: < Follows-Chalk Generic Barks >
topics.response_text: Feels good to be doing some actual scouting, not just following.

topics.topic_text: <Follows-Chalk Guide Bark 1 >
topics.response_text: We follow this path for a while. Nice view of the river, neh?

topics.topic_text: <Follows-Chalk Guide Bark 2 >
topics.response_text: You can take the path north here if you want, or head east over the ridge. There's a nice view from the top of that cliff, if you want a look.

topics.topic_text: <Follows-Chalk Guide Bark 3 >
topics.response_text: Keep headed north, around this rock pile.

topics.topic_text: <Follows-Chalk Guide Bark 4 >
topics.response_text: Follow the old road south, nearly there.

topics.topic_text: <Follows-Chalk Guide Bark 5 >
topics.response_text: You see the dead sentries? Shamans say our enemies' souls are trapped in them, but Joshua says it shows we're serious about fighting White Legs.

topics.topic_text: <Follows-Chalk Guide Bark 6 >
topics.response_text: Down this path to the north. Hope you don't mind getting wet.

topics.topic_text: < Follows-Chalk Guide Bark 7 >
topics.response_text: Nearly there now. Watch out for traps in the water. Got to keep the White Legs out somehow, neh?

topics.topic_text: < Follows-Chalk Guide Bark 8 >
topics.response_text: Here we are. Joshua's just ahead there, in the Angel Cave.

topics.topic_text: <Follows-Chalk Guide Wrong Way Barks >
topics.response_text: Hang on, you're going the wrong way!

topics.topic_text: < Follows-Chalk Three Marys Bark >
topics.response_text: Heads up, this is the Three Marys. White Legs territory. You sure you want to head in there?

topics.topic_text: < Follows-Chalk Mural Bark >
topics.response_text: These paintings show the Dead Horses' victories against other tribes. Lots more of them since Joshua came to us.

topics.topic_text: < Follows Chalk Narrows Bark >
topics.response_text: The Narrows up ahead, that's the Sorrows' territory. They're peaceful enough, but you don't want to make them mad.

topics.topic_text: < Follows-Chalk Overlook Bark >
topics.response_text: Scenic Overlook. What do you suppose that means?

topics.topic_text: < Follows-Chalk Perk Bark >
topics.response_text: Some kind of view up here, neh? If you know how to look, you can spot all kinds of landmarks from up here. Look, I'll show you.

topics.topic_text: < Follows-Chalk Pine Creek Bark >
topics.response_text: That's Pine Creek up there. Supposedly it's one of only two ways out of Zion Valley. Of course, without a map, good luck surviving.

topics.topic_text: < Follows-Chalk Plane Bark >
topics.response_text: That thing actually flew once, like a big metal bird?{Wistful}Bet you don't have to follow chalk marks up there....

topics.topic_text: < Follows-Chalk post-ambush greeting >
topics.response_text: Hoo! That's for the White Legs! Sorry we weren't fast enough to save your friends, though. The Dead Horses will remember them in our prayers.

topics.topic_text: < Follows-Chalk Taboo Area Bark >
topics.response_text: For as long as I remember, the Dead Horses have thought that places of the old world were taboo. Doesn't look so spooky to me.

topics.topic_text: < Follows-Chalk Taboo Marks Bark >
topics.response_text: See those handprints? Dead Horses and Sorrows mark them on taboo places, places from Back When. Good thing for you I don't buy into that stuff.

topics.topic_text: < Follows-Chalk bark about tree trunk containers >
topics.response_text: Hold up, see that log over there? Take a closer look. There might be some good stuff tucked in there.

topics.topic_text: < Follows-Chalk Vault 22 Bark >
topics.response_text: You ever seen anything like these green men? Sure as anything they aren't from around here.

topics.topic_text: < Follows Chalk Eastern Virgin Bark >
topics.response_text: Ah, the Eastern Virgin. What's the phrase? "House sweet house?"

topics.topic_text: < Follows Chalk greets the player at the Eastern Virgin. >
topics.response_text: Glad you made it. Joshua's just to the south, inside the Angel Cave. You'll want to talk to him straight away.

topics.topic_text: < Follows-Chalk Yao Guai Bark >
topics.response_text: {Hushed, tense, big scary monster ahead!}Freeze! Don't move a muscle. Yao Guai.

conversation.response_text: They're cutting through me like paper!
{Limb crippled, in pain}Ahh! I'm going to need a healer!
Joshua isn't going to like this....
{Half health, in pain}I could use some help here!
{Quarter health, near death}If I don't make it... tell Joshua... I tried.
Remind me not to get you mad at me.
{Awkward, the player just stole from him}Um... you know I'll share if you ask, right?
{Healing a crippled limb}There... hopefully it won't fall off now.
{Waking up from being knocked out}Oh, look, I'm not dead.
Might as well tickle them with a feather!

combat.response_text: Still looking, but I got nothing.
They must've run off. Scared of us, huh?

description:
Follows-Chalk is a 19 year-old Caucasian Male.

A curious and adventurous young tribal member of the Dead Horse tribe, living in Zion Canyon. Unlike most of his tribe, Follows-Chalk is willing to enter pre-War buildings, driven by a childhood dream to explore the world beyond his home.

Follows-Chalk's Personality: Curious, adventurous, and open-minded with a neutral moral compass. Follows-Chalk is eager to learn about the wider world and is willing to challenge tribal taboos in pursuit of knowledge and experience. He respects his tribe's traditions but dreams of one day seeing what lies beyond Zion Canyon.

Follows-Chalk's Backstory: Born and raised in the Dead Horse tribe in Zion Canyon, Follows-Chalk's life was forever changed when he was a young boy. A caravan passed through the valley with a tall man with a big mustache who carried a guitar. When Follows-Chalk asked what the man did for a living, he learned that the man was a singer who traveled from place to place, performing in exchange for food, shelter, and care. This concept of a world where a man could simply sing for his living fascinated the young tribal, and he promised himself that one day he would explore that world himself. His name comes from his role in the tribe - while experienced Dead Horse scouts leave chalk marks to indicate areas with plentiful game, Follows-Chalk, not yet a full scout, simply follows these chalk marks.
